translated: The Elder Nuns’ Verses🔽The Chapter with Khattiyas
The Elder Nun Aḍḍhakāsī’s Verses
“In this auspicious aeon,
the kinsman of Brahmā, of great fame,🔽the best of speakers,
was called Kassapa.
Then, having gone forth,
in the dispensation of that Buddha,
I was restrained in the Pāṭimokkha,
and in the five senses.
I was moderate in food,
and I was devoted to wakefulness.
Living devoted to the practice,
I was a nun free from defilements.
With a wicked mind I abused her,
calling her a prostitute at the time.
Because of that wicked deed,
I was tormented in hell.
Because of the remaining result of that deed,
I was reborn in a prostitute’s family,🔽and in my last rebirth
I was very much dependent on others.
In the Kāsī country, born into a merchant family,

analyzed: brahmacārī balena aha  accharā viya devesu
translated: through the power of celibacy,🔽I had perfect beauty,
like a celestial nymph among the gods.
Seeing my beautiful form,
in the supreme city of Giribbaja,🔽they made me a prostitute,
because of the power of my abuse.
Having heard the true Teaching,
The best of Buddhas taught it.
I was well-endowed with the previous requisites,🔽And I went forth from the household life into homelessness.🔽When I went to the Victorious One

analyzed: tat ūpasampad atthāya  gacchantī jina santika  magge dhutte ṭhite sutvā
translated: To receive the full ordination,🔽I heard the Dhamma on the road,
And I received the higher ordination as a messenger.
All my bad kamma was exhausted,
And so too my merit and my evil.
I was liberated from all existence,
And I rejected the life of a prostitute.
I became powerful in psychic abilities,
And in the divine ear-element.
I became powerful in the knowledge of others’ minds,
And in the knowledge of past lives,
And in the divine eye.
All my pollutants are exhausted,

analyzed: na atthi dāni punabbhavaḥ  attha dhamma niruttīsu
translated: And there is no return to any existence.🔽In the meaning, the Dhamma, and the phrasing,
And in ready speech,
My knowledge has arisen, Great Hero,
In your presence.
My defilements have been burned up,
I live without pollutants.
Welcome indeed it was for me
I have done the Buddha’s bidding.
The four analytical knowledges
I have done the Buddha’s bidding.”

original: Itthaṁ sudaṁ aḍḍhakāsi bhikkhunī imā gāthāyo abhāsitthāti.🔽Aḍḍhakāsitheriyāpadānaṁ sattamaṁ.
analyzed: ittham sudam aḍḍhakā asi bhikkhunī imāḥ gāthāyaḥ abhāsittha ati 🔽aḍḍhaka asitheriya apadānam sattama
translated: The Story of the Elder Nun Aḍḍhakāsī is finished.
